title: Wi-Fi (com.apple.wifi.managed)
description: Use this section to define Wi-Fi settings

IsHotspot.title: Is Hotspot
IsHotspot.description: If the network should be treated as a Legacy Hotspot or Passpoint network.

SSID_STR.title: Service Set Identifier (SSID)
SSID_STR.description: Displayed name of the wireless network

HIDDEN_NETWORK.title: Hidden Network
HIDDEN_NETWORK.description: Specify whether the network that the device connects to is broadcasting its identity.

AutoJoin.title: Auto Join
AutoJoin.description: Automatically join the network without notifying users.

CaptiveBypass.title: Disable Captive Network Detection
CaptiveBypass.description: Users won’t have an opportunity to join networks that require agreements or other information prior to network access.

DisableAssociationMACRandomization.title: Disable MAC Address Randomization
DisableAssociationMACRandomization.description: If true, disables MAC address randomization for that Wi-Fi network while associated with the network. This also shows a privacy warning in Settings indicating that the network has reduced privacy protections.

ProxyType.title: Proxy Type
ProxyType.description: The type of proxy configuration to use for this wireless connection.

ProxyServer.title: Proxy Server
ProxyServer.description: The hostname of the proxy server.

ProxyServerPort.title: Proxy Server Port
ProxyServerPort.description: The port used to connect to the proxy server.

ProxyUsername.title: Proxy Username
ProxyUsername.description: The user name for the manual proxy connection.

ProxyPassword.title: Proxy Password
ProxyPassword.description: The password for the manual proxy connection.

ProxyPACURL.title: Proxy PAC URL
ProxyPACURL.description: URL used to receive proxy settings. If no URL is specified, the device uses the web proxy autodiscovery protocol (WPAD) to discover proxies

ProxyPACFallbackAllowed.title: Proxy PAC Fallback
ProxyPACFallbackAllowed.description: Enable to allow direct connection if PAC is unreachable

EncryptionType.title: Encryption Type
EncryptionType.description: Wireless network encryption to use when connecting. The None value is available in iOS 5.0 and later and the WPA2 value is available in iOS 8.0 and later

Password.title: Password
Password.description: Specifies the password for the access point.

DisplayedOperatorName.title: Provider Display Name
DisplayedOperatorName.description: Display name of the Passpoint service provider.

DomainName.title: Domain Name
DomainName.description: Domain name of the Passpoint service provider.

ServiceProviderRoamingEnabled.title: Connect to roaming partner Passpoint networks
ServiceProviderRoamingEnabled.description: Specify whether to connect to additional Passpoint networks pre-approved by the service provider.

RoamingConsortiumOIs.title: Roaming OIs
RoamingConsortiumOIs.description: Enter a series of digits corresponding to one of the service provider’s Passpoint network.

NAIRealmNames.title: Realm Names
NAIRealmNames.description: Enter the known NAI realm names.

SetupModes.title: EAP Setup Modes
SetupModes.description: Select "Login Window" to authenticate the Mac to the network when the user logs in.

items.title: EAP Type
items.description: An integer representing an EAP type, inside of the Accept EAP Types array.

UserName.title: Username
UserName.description: Username. If not provided, the user may be prompted during login.

UserPassword.title: Password
UserPassword.description: Password. If not provided, the user may be prompted during login.

OneTimeUserPassword.title: Per-Connection Password
OneTimeUserPassword.description: If set, the user will be prompted for a password each time they connect to the network.

items.title: Individual Certificate Anchor UUID
items.description: A UUID for a trusted certificate

PayloadCertificateAnchorUUID.title: Certificate Anchor UUID
PayloadCertificateAnchorUUID.description: Array of UUIDs corresponding to the trusted certificates for this authentication.

items.title: Individual Trusted TLS Server Name
items.description: An item in the TLS Trusted Server Names array representing a Common Name of a server certificate.

TLSTrustedServerNames.title: Trusted Server Certificate Names
TLSTrustedServerNames.description: Certificate Common Names expected from authentication server. The wildcard * can be used to match a range of strings.

TLSAllowTrustExceptions.title: Allow Trust Exceptions
TLSAllowTrustExceptions.description: Allows a dynamic trust decision by the user.

TTLSInnerAuthentication.title: Inner Authentication
TTLSInnerAuthentication.description: Specifies the inner authentication used by the TTLS module.

OuterIdentity.title: Outer Identity
OuterIdentity.description: Externally visible identification (for TTLS, PEAP, and EAP-FAST). This string is used instead of the user's identity outside the encrypted tunnel. This value can be used to mask the true identity of the person using the network.

EAPFASTUsePAC.title: Use PAC
EAPFASTUsePAC.description: If set, the device will use an existing PAC if it's present. Otherwise the server must present its identity using a certificate.

EAPFASTProvisionPACAnonymously.title: Provision PAC Anonymously
EAPFASTProvisionPACAnonymously.description: If set, provisions the device anonymously. Note that there are known man-in-the-middle attacks for anonymous provisioning.

EAPSIMNumberOfRANDs.title: Number of RANDs
EAPSIMNumberOfRANDs.description: The minimum number of RAND values accepted from the server. 3 is the default, and 2 is allowed, but offers less security.

SystemModeCredentialsSource.title: System Profile Credentials Source
SystemModeCredentialsSource.description: Use an alternate set of credentials when in System mode (AKA not a loginwindow profile). This can be used to tell EAPOLClient to use the computer password in a bound active directory scenario for authentication.

SystemModeUseOpenDirectoryCredentials.title: Use OpenDirectory System Profile Credentials
SystemModeUseOpenDirectoryCredentials.description: This indicates if the connection should try to use the OpenDirectory machine credentials.

QoSMarkingEnabled.title: Allow QoS marking
QoSMarkingEnabled.description: Enable any kind of QoS marking.

QoSMarkingAppleAudioVideoCalls.title: QoS marking for audio/video calls
QoSMarkingAppleAudioVideoCalls.description: Enable QoS for WiFi Calling, FaceTime, SMS, etc.

QoSMarkingAllowListAppIdentifiers.title: Allow List App Identifiers
QoSMarkingAllowListAppIdentifiers.description: Add specific apps to an allow list for QoS marking.

QoSMarkingWhitelistedAppIdentifiers.title: Allowlisted App Identifiers
QoSMarkingWhitelistedAppIdentifiers.description: Add specific apps to an allow list for QoS marking.

PayloadCertificateUUID.title: Certificate UUID
PayloadCertificateUUID.description: UUID of the certificate payload containing an identity used as the client credential.

TLSCertificateRequired.title: Certificate Required
TLSCertificateRequired.description: If set, force a non-default authentication method. (if YES, uses certificate from PayloadCertificateUUID).
